channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OK

item.title: Report X-2023080051
item.description:
Report X-2023080051

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: EDMOND
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: pail seemed to have been dropped and placed in a tote. When it was discovered to be a hazmat I placed it in a hazmat tote and processed it. DescribePack: cracks on the bottom of the pail. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: hazmat tote with bag

item.description:
Report I-2023070039

  • City: Oklahoma City
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: YRC FREIGHT
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading the trailer, two boxes were found damaged and leaking. The release was properly managed. The damaged freight was placed into a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2023071222
item.description:
Report X-2023071222

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-22
  • City: EDMOND
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found in unload, leaking. Placed in tote. DescribePack: Package has no transport labels, secures on bottle caps, or inner packaging. Leaking likely due to improper bracing. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in tote.

item.title: Report X-2023071151
item.description:
Report X-2023071151

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: EDMOND
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package given to QA, leaking. Placed in tote. DescribePack: Sterifab bottle was in separate inner box, with a loose cap. Package had no inner packaging and no transport label. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in tote.

item.title: Report X-2023071053
item.description:
Report X-2023071053

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: EDMOND
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package brought back to VSA, leaking. Placed in tote to prevent further leakage. DescribePack: Package only had piece of cardboard between half of bottles. No other inner packaging, no cap secures. Bottles busted on bottom possibly due to having no inner packaging. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in tote to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023071020
item.description:
Report X-2023071020

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: On Jul 11, package was found leaking in the Unload from a customer-loaded pickup trailer. DescribePack: Contents were dented and the lids came loose causing spillage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Spill-Kit was used to contain spillage and package and cleanup was placed in a lined 20Gal yellow salvage drum.
